summary: "The Old Man and the Sea" is a short novel by Ernest Hemingway about an old fisherman named Santiago. He struggles to catch a huge fish called a marlin. Hemingway wrote it in Cuba during a hard time in his life. He finished it quickly, writing a thousand words a day. The story was very popular when it came out in 1952, selling lots of copies and winning big awards. Some people loved it because they thought it was better than his last book. But over time, some critics started to say it wasn't as great as everyone thought. People still talk about whether it's one of Hemingway's best works.
title: The Old Man and the Sea
